narrative: Environment credentials loaded from $HOME/.env. Updated Makefile to use explicit repository-url for TestPyPI. Attempted `make test-release`; build succeeded but upload returned HTTPError 400 Bad Request despite credentials.
user_input:
twine upload --repository-url https://test.pypi.org/legacy/ dist/*
that is what should publish, make sure you have sourced the $HOME/.env  (the twine username and password is in there)

* Report on that results because your training data might be outdated
scene: Before: make test-release didn’t run twine due to mis-indented command. After: command executed with credentials but server responded 400 Bad Request.
